intro: Tecticornia indefessa, commonly known as the coastal tecticornia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are adapted for pollination by wind and insects. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access deep water sources and survive prolonged droughts. Tecticornia indefessa is often found in sandy soils along coastal dunes and inland salt lakes.
